meanings.definition: The act or process of dividing into four equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the quarterage of the pizza to the students.
meanings.sent2: The quarterage of the cake was perfect for sharing among the four friends.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to do the quarterage of their candy, but ended up with uneven pieces.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the players had to strategize the quarterage of the map to conquer different territories.
meanings.sent5: The farmer divided the field with precision, ensuring the quarterage was accurate.

meanings.definition: A fee or tax paid quarterly.
meanings.sent1: The company accountant calculated the quarterly quarterage for the business.
meanings.sent2: The homeowner paid the quarterage for the property tax on time.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected increase in quarterage left many residents scrambling to budget their expenses.
meanings.sent4: The government announced a reduction in quarterage to ease the financial burden on citizens.
meanings.sent5: The quarterly quarterage was a regular expense that the family budgeted for each year.

meanings.definition: The amount of money paid as a quarterly fee or tax.
meanings.sent1: The accountant kept track of the quarterage paid by the clients.
meanings.sent2: The quarterly quarterage was a significant part of the company's expenses.
meanings.sent3: The sudden increase in quarterage caught many by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The quarterage for the services rendered was reasonable and fair.
meanings.sent5: The company budgeted for the quarterly quarterage to ensure financial stability.
